lines.text: Cowabunga, dude! How did you ever get so totally cool?

[the chipmunks and ALF discover what Michael is hiding in the box; Theodore sniffs the air]
What's that funny smell?
I hate to suggest this, but my guess would be... marijuana, an unlawful substance used to experience artificial highs.

[encountering Michael in a alley]
What's dis?
[picks up something Michael had dropped by a trashcan]
... A joint? So, what's the big attraction?
You use, you lose!
There's nothing cool about a fool on drugs!

[Alf shows Michael what he will look like in the future, via a mirror]
Who is that?
Well, it's not Freddy Krueger. This is you. Pretty pitiful, huh?

[shocked after discovering that Michael stole Corey's piggy bank]
I can't believe it! Corey's own brother?
Wally never did this sort of thing to The Beav.

[after emerging from a picture frame on Corey's dresser after her piggy bank is stolen]
You wanna help track down the thief, Garfield?

[Garfield is a lamp]
Hey, going through life with a blue lampshade is work enough. Wake me when the lasagna comes.
do you wanna help, or do you wanna be lunch?

[salutes and climbs off the dresser]
My luck to be stuck on a dresser with a pushy alien.
There's someone who needs your help!
What? Another autograph hound?
The sound of a breaking piggy... if ever I've heard one.
The sound of a breaking piggy, and the sizzle of hot lasagna.
I don't like the looks of this.
Neither do I. No food in sight.
What's all this for?
Either someone's conducting a major chemistry experiment, or this is a serious no-no.
Toto, something tells me we're not in cartoon territory anymore.
Okay, you win. You got me dead to rights. I'm not a cop, I'm a rabbit, but just because I got long ears doesn't mean there's nothing in between 'em.
What's wrong? What's happening?
Drugs! This what they do to your brain, Michael.
Actually, this is just one artist's conception.
I gotta get off of these drugs.
Drugs? Oh, bad news, Michael!
Why don't you just say "no"?
Well, maybe it's because I don't want to.
Maybe it's because you don't know how.
Open the box, Corey.
If I were you, which I'm not, I wouldn't listen to him.
[Smoke throws Pooh into a cabinet]
Oh, bother!
Pooh bear!
Relax, he's only cloth and stuffing. Besides, that bear doesn't get around much. I do. Trust me. Open the box.
Where's the color?
Listen, kid. This is the past, and the past is in black and white. Get it?
Hey! He's gonna fall!
Abandon brain!
Weirdos and pigs first!
You were running from a rabbit? He's a cartoon!
[laughs]
Look who's talking.
Hey, this isn't romantic, it's not even pretty, and most important, I DON'T LIKE IT IN HERE!
What's up, Doc, is your life, if you don't get off those drugs.
Listen to me, Mikey.
I think I've listened to you long enough!
You can't get rid of me this easily! I'll be back, and you can bet on it!
He's right, you know. He will try to come back.
When he gets here, we'll be ready for him! Right, guys?
Right!
This is odd. The picture is very dark. All I can see is...
You're looking into a bowling ball.
Yes, of course. That would explain the 7-10 split.

[about Michael's future]
Ah, yes, I can see it all! Well, some of it.
That kid's got a one-way ticket to Nowheresville.
Simon suspects drugs.
Oh, my!
Ooh! That's bad moves!
Michael needs our help!
Then let's help him!
You're acting really weird.
So who asked you?
[Bugs takes out a blue block with a red button on it. He presses it and drops it on the ground. It turns into a time machine]
A time machine?
I borrowed it from some coyote.
[Michael and Smoke have fallen through an open manhole into a sewer. They see Michaelangelo of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles]
Cowabunga, dude! How did you ever get so totally cool?
What are we doing down here?
Like, you fell through a radical hole, dude! You could've avoided it, but you weren't thinking. Come to think of it, that's a lot of your problem.
What problem?
Drugs, bud. Your brain must be, like, really messed up.
[Michael sees himself on his deathbed]
It's- it's me. This is my future?
It is if you don't get off those drugs!
[some cartoon characters visit and help Michael]
You use, you lose!
Listen to us! We care about you, Mikey!
What's up, doc, is your life, if you don't cut it out.
There's nothing cool about a fool on drugs!

[altogether]
Just believe in yourself!
Yeah! You're excellent just the way you are! Without drugs!

[scared]
HOW DO I GET OUT OF HERE?
[a door back to Michael's room appears in front of him and the characters]

[as he and Michael approach a mirror]
What do you see?
Me. I see me.
Wrong!
[blows a whistle]
Flag on the play! Ten point penalty!
[ALF spins the mirror and shows Michael's future reflection]
Who's that?
Well, it's not Freddy Krueger. This is you. Pretty pitiful, huh? You see, drugs aren't you pal, pal. They're your enemy, storming the battlements, trying to take control.
I can quit if I want to! I'm in charge of my life!
Wrong! Not if you're on drugs.

[throwing the drugs away]
Corey! Don't you ever, EVER, ever do this stuff!
But you did it!
I was a dope. I was wrong.
Then stop! Please, Michael.
I don't know if I can.
Face it, kid. We're buddies for life, whether you like it or not.
You don't have to quit on your own. Talk to Mom and Dad! They'll help! I'll help!
Listen to me, Mikey.
I think I've listened to you long enough.
[he throws Smoke out a window, sending him into a garbage truck]
You can't get rid of me this easy! I'll be back, and you can bet on it!
He's right, you know. He will try to come back.
And when he gets here, we'll be ready for him. Right, guys?

[on a poster]
Right!
